metadata.title: William Fargues
metadata.description: Welcome to the portfolio of William Fargues, senior web engineer and developer.

header.alt_logo: Return to the top of the site
header.drawer_description: Quickly access all sections of the site

cover_page.description: With rigor, attentiveness, and methodology, I design modern, reliable, custom-made solutions built to last. I'm excited at the prospect of working with you.
cover_page.available_tooltip: Currently working but still open to opportunities

about_me.title: Who am I?
about_me.subtitle: My story and my mission for your projects
about_me.paragraph1: Hello, I'm William, a passionate engineer and web developer. Since my first projects in engineering school, I have continuously honed my skills and pushed my limits to meet a wide range of technical challenges. What motivates me? Designing elegant, reliable solutions tailored to the unique needs of each project.
about_me.paragraph2: Throughout my experiences, I have had the opportunity to work on both frontend and backend challenges, strengthening my skills in both areas. I excel most in frontend, where I derive the greatest pleasure in innovating.
about_me.paragraph3: Today, I bring this versatility and experience to companies of all sizes, with a clear goal: to transform your ideas into concrete, high-performing, and lasting projects.

career.title: My professional journey
career.subtitle: The experiences that shape my expertise

experiences.title: Senior Frontend Web Developer
experiences.company_description: Bebeboutik is a private sales platform dedicated to early childhood. This platform is available in several formats: a private sales website, a mobile app for private sales, as well as a marketplace-style website.
experiences.team: The team I work with is composed of 5-6 people: the CTO, 3 backend developers, and 1-2 frontend developers. I primarily collaborate with my team members and occasionally with other departments, such as the marketing department.

projects.description: Migration of the private sales website from Prestashop to NextJS.
Complete overhaul of the private sales mobile app.
Creation of a dashboard-style website for various suppliers.

experiences.title: Web Developer
experiences.company_description: Sopra Steria is a French digital services company and a consultancy in digital transformation for businesses and organizations.
experiences.team: I worked on the Ecomode project (a mobile app that supports and rewards low-carbon daily commutes in the Toulouse area). Our team ranged from 5 to 12 people depending on the project phase, including a project manager, a scrum master, an architect, 3 business analysts, and the remaining developers. I mainly collaborated with team members and occasionally with other departments such as UI/UX designers.

projects.description: Development of the public Ecomode mobile app.
Implementation of a microservices-based backend architecture.
Creation of a management web application for the Ecomode mobile app.

experiences.title: Web Developer
experiences.company_description: Sopra Steria is a French digital services company and a consultancy in digital transformation for businesses and organizations.
experiences.team: I worked in a department called 'Factory', specialized in rapid prototyping of custom applications. Our department consisted of around 25 people: a department head, 2 architects, and the remaining developers. We were assigned to various projects in smaller teams (generally 3 to 5 people) with an average duration of 3 to 6 months. I primarily collaborated with members of the 'Factory' and often with clients as well.

projects.description: Creation of a web application for managing/locating Bluetooth beacons.
Prototyping of a real-time 3D web application to visualize airplanes.
Development of a web application for controlling building access.

experiences.title: Web Developer Intern
experiences.company_description: Expleo Group is a digital services company and a global provider of engineering, technology, and consultancy services.
experiences.team: The team I was part of consisted of 5 people: a project manager and 4 developers. We were assigned to various projects in smaller teams (generally 3 to 5 people) with an average duration of 3 to 6 months. I mainly collaborated with my team members.

projects.description: Redesign of an internal web application dedicated to project management, with a particular focus on the user interface.

projects.title: My Journey in Action
projects.subtitle: From Concept to Execution: A Look at Remarkable Projects

works.title: Bebeboutik | Dashboard
works.name: Dashboard
works.description: This project involves the creation of a dashboard designed for suppliers on the private sales website. The platform allows them to perform several actions, such as checking ongoing sales and viewing the site's performance figures. It was developed end-to-end in NextJS, encompassing both frontend and backend.
works.image_alt: Mockup of the Bebeboutik Dashboard web application
responsabilities: Develop and maintain the dashboard using NextJS.
Responsible for integrating both the frontend and backend (virtually full control).
Create a responsive and high-performance user interface using ReactJS, TailwindCSS, and caching.
Manage the backend integration with NextJS, DrizzleORM, and MySQL to deliver comprehensive functionalities.

works.title: Bebeboutik | Websites
works.name: Websites
works.description: This project involves developing two interconnected websites—a private sales site and a marketplace—sharing a large portion of code through a monorepo configuration. The work focuses exclusively on the frontend aspects of these sites.
works.image_alt: Mockup of the Bebeboutik web application
responsabilities: Develop and maintain the websites using NextJS.
Responsible for integrating the frontend (in consultation with the CTO).
Implement caching strategies to enhance performance using Redis.
Set up a monorepo to share code between the two sites.
Create a GraphQL server for efficient data handling with the backend.
Collaborate with two backend developers working with PHP to ensure smooth integration between the frontend and backend.

other_info.team: 2 backend developers and 1-2 frontend developers (including me) plus the CTO

works.title: Bebeboutik | Mobile Application
works.name: Mobile Application
works.description: This project involves developing the mobile version of the private sales website. Although it does not share its code with the website, the app uses the same GraphQL API. Built entirely in React Native (Expo), it is the main revenue source with several million downloads on the App Store and Play Store.
works.image_alt: Mockup of the Bebeboutik mobile application
responsabilities: Develop and maintain the mobile application using React Native (Expo).
Ensure integration with the backend via the GraphQL server for data synchronization.
Collaborate with two backend developers working with PHP to ensure smooth integration between the app and the backend.

other_info.team: 2 backend developers and 1-2 frontend developers (including me) plus the CTO

works.title: Sopra Steria | Ecomode
works.name: Ecomode
works.description: This project involved the development of two distinct applications: a mobile app for the general public and a web interface for administrators. In parallel, I contributed to the backend development, which was based on a microservices architecture using NodeJS.
works.image_alt: Mockup of the Ecomode mobile application
responsabilities: Participate in the development of the mobile app using React Native.
Contribute to creating the administrative web interface in ReactJS.
Work on the backend in NodeJS within a microservices architecture.
Collaborate within a team of 4 to 8 developers in an agile environment.

other_info.team: 1 project manager, 1 scrum master, 1 architect, 3 business analysts, and 3-6 fullstack developers (including me)

works.title: Personal | Planidays
works.name: Planidays
works.description: Planidays is a web application for travel planning assisted by AI, developed in my free time with a friend. This project covers frontend, backend, and artificial intelligence.
works.image_alt: Mockup of the Planidays web application
responsabilities: Design and develop the web application using NextJS.
Implement the AI component by integrating the OpenAI API with Vercel's AI SDK for travel planning assistance.
Build and maintain the backend using NextJS, DrizzleORM, and PostgreSQL, ensuring smooth communication between the various system components.
Work closely with another developer to share responsibilities across all parts of the project.
Establish a clear vision for the project's evolution and then organize and prioritize tasks.

my_stack.title: Technologies at the heart of my projects
my_stack.subtitle: The tools I use daily to develop modern and high-performance solutions
